description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6av1f","text":"The protocol summarises the procedures used for analytical control. The protocol describes the Standard Operating Procedure (SOP) for the optimization of advanced tertiary treatment of water, based on a comprehensive quality and risk assessment.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eula2","text":"Relevant food-borne parasites are not included in any normative. steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bshkb","text":"The water production for AWARE main activities includes three stages – disinfection by ultraviolet C radiation (UVC), storage for - (according to water load and season) and ozonation. The water quality is monitored at these three stages, for the parameters indicated in Figure 1 below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":129,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":131,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1pre","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eqkgb","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3he0","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":43200,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":0,"preset":[],"start":0}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"2":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":288.9454545454546,"id":466682,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"1-.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz6cd64x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz4cd64x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz5cd64x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz3cd64x.webp","width":580}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c15gq","text":"Sampling, Processing, and Analyses ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":34}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4fd16","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4s37q","text":"Water samples are collected (see Figure 2) and processed within a interval, before being shipped for the partner responsible for the analyses (Table 1). In case no processing is needed, samples are frozen and stored at within .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":218,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":225,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3d6g","text":"\nFor each sampling event, the date, day of the week and hour; the temperature and rain. Sampling points, indicated in Figure 2 were designated from A to I:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8lbfh","text":"- Influent of primary treatment (A) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68ej9","text":"- Influent of biological treatment (activated sludge) (B) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9p90e","text":"- Treated secondary effluent (C) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frs08","text":"- Sand filter effluent (D) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bp68r","text":"- UVC effluent (E) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36rj4","text":"- Storage for reuse tank effluent (F) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8hod4","text":"- Ozonation effluent (1 dose, e.g., O3) - MITO3X technology - (G) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":35,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"34b31","text":"- Effluent of the vacuum UV oxidation (VUV) (H) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2hp99","text":"- Effluent of reactive storage / Influent of the recirculation aquaculture system (RAS) (I) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ud8p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d71gt","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ej8k3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":21600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":10800,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"4":{"type":"image","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"height":319.5272727272727,"id":466686,"is_video":false,"legend":"{\"blocks\":null,\"entityMap\":null}","mime":"image/png","originalFile":{},"original_name":"2--.png","placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qh2acd64x.jpg","source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz8cd64x.jpg","type":1,"webp_placeholder":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz9cd64x.webp","webp_source":"https://content.protocols.io/files/qhz7cd64x.webp","width":580}}}}

steps.section: Methods: Processing of Water samples - The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
Methods: Processing of Water samples - The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4fae3","text":"Filtration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e6u1d","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g3le","text":" of water were filtered through 0.45 µm pore size diameter Nitrocellulose / polycarbonate sterile membranes, using a membrane filter holder ( ) apparatus. For every approx. of water, a new sterile membrane was used to avoid clogging of membranes. Filters corresponding to each litre of water were separated, inserted into well-sealed tubes (  stored a and then transported in dry ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":32,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":141,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":172,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":341,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":351,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"3","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}},"1":{"type":"thickness","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"diameter","scientificNotation":false,"unit":201,"value":"47"}},"2":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"3":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"4":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}}}}

Pellets resuspended in formaldehyde solution were centrifugated at for  , the supernatant was discarded and all pellets were pooled in of  ethanol. steps.section: Methods: Processing of Water samples - The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7fhns","text":"DNA Isolation, Amplification and sequencing: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"128ps","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89dj1","text":"DNA extraction was carried out using a commercially available kit (Powerwater kit, Qiagen) in accordance with the manufacturer's guidelines. The V4 and V9 of the 18S rRNA gene hypervariable regions of the eukaryote 18S rRNA gene were amplified using universal primers. Subsequently, PCR products were purified and subjected to external sequencing using Illumina MiSeq platform 300bp paired-end sequencing.  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Methods: Processing of Water samples - The section below summarises the procedures used for analytical control – detailed protocols are annexed to this protocol.
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"fenpi","text":"Bioinformatic analysis: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dpv3q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c5kku","text":"Raw sequence data were processed using QIIME2 software 2023.9. Pairedend reads were subjected to quality filtering (FastQC) and denoising (DADA2 plugin). Subsequently, the taxonomic assignment was conducted using the reference database SILVA 18S release 138 with a clustering threshold of similarity. Alpha rarefaction analysis, Shannon diversity index, richness estimation, and relative abundance calculations were performed using the Vegan R package to assess microbial community diversity and composition particularly focusing on the detection of genetic material from potential pathogens. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":288,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"humidity","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"99","guid":"","id":0}}}}
